website_summaries.verdict: A sound choice if the design appeals to you. It saves a lot of space if your closet and shoes will accommodate it.
pros: An affordable, space-saving model that is simple to put together and hang
Features a no-slip design and space for 36 pairs of shoes
cons: Consumers found that it won't work with small closets, and some large shoes fall off the shelves

customer_reviews.title: Some Improvising Required
customer_reviews.text: This shoe rack was too big and cumbersome for my small closet door (it shifted every time the door was opened or closed). So I had to install it on an inside wall of the closet. I did not use the two metal support brackets, but instead drilled holes into the top side supports and attached the rack to the wall with screws. Works great. See photo.
customer_reviews.author: Movie Maker (Wash, DC)

customer_reviews.title: my husband adjusted for 24" door
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to share this tip: My husband used a pipe cutter to cut 1 1/8 inch off each rod and now this fits perfectly on my 24" door with the door knob. It's been up for a week now and seems sturdy. I'm thankful for the organization and extra floor space!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Dunn

customer_reviews.title: This thing is aweful...
customer_reviews.text: These work fairly well except when all of the bars come lose and the shoes come crashing to the floor in the middle of the night. I thought Jesus had returned. To me that is a problem and to me it is a big one. The manufacturer cut the bars so short that they will not stay on place...I glued the bars in place with Gorilla glue and the device works well. Seems to me saving fractions of a penny and getting a less favorable Amazon review is less than optimal. Leave a few centimeters and get higher customer satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. W.

customer_reviews.title: LOVED it when I installed it.. BUT...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my apartment in the city. LOVED it when I installed it. Had about 25 pairs of shoes on it... I have size 5 1/2 feet and they were mostly sandals etc... I came back a week later and it had snapped in half and all the shoes where on the floor. NOT HAPPY.
customer_reviews.author: jPEG in GA

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: This is made so poorly. Every time I open my closet door one or more of the rails falls off and shoes come cascading down. Update: I endured another week of trying to live my life with an expectation of being besieged by shoes every morning. Couldn’t stick with it. Finally had a meltdown and threw the contraption in the garbage. Don’t know why I stuck with it for so long- sheer stubbornness thinking I could will it into staying fixed for the next day. What a waste of time, money and emotion. If you buy this useless shoe rack do not be surprised if it assaults you. You were warned.
customer_reviews.author: Bookish Biz

customer_reviews.title: So they come undone and your shoes fall down pretty easily. 2) The unit is too wide to ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a couple of problems with this right out of the box. 1) The metal poles are not long enough to fully insert to both ends. So they come undone and your shoes fall down pretty easily. 2) The unit is too wide to fit a normal interior door. There was not a single door in the home that it would fit on AND allow me to close the door. Most of the time, one side would be stuck on the doorknob, so it wouldn't lay back flush to the door.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: The “metal” hanging clips suck!
customer_reviews.text: I would give this product ZERO stars if possible! The bars don’t stay in place and are constantly falling off causing the shoes to slide out of place and the door brackets are crap. They don’t stay in place over the door and are make of very cheap material/metal. I’d love to return but already threw the box away.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: broken first day!!! Soooo disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.text: one of the over door hooks started bending which caused unit to be lop sided which of course caused poles to loosen and everything came crashing down to the floor!!! Disapointed because I had all my shoes organized nicely and I went the extra step giving the poles a few taps with the mallet I think it's called or soft hammer to make sure all was secure. Just awful! My money is wasted and now I have to look for and purchase a whole new product.
customer_reviews.author: grace

customer_reviews.title: Neat concept, not well made.
customer_reviews.text: After it was put together I was very impressed.... Until it started breaking apart before its first use. Apparently the piece that holds each shelf in that allows it to swivel up and down is extremely small and fragile, and breaks very easily. As a result, I had to Jerry rig the entire rack with wire and glue to hold it together or else make the decision to throw it away. We will see if my solution lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Easy to build, but it also "un-builds" itself easily
customer_reviews.text: This product was quite easy to put together; it's just a matter of snapping together the plastic sidewalls and inserting the metal shelving poles between them. I did it in under 15 minutes. However, the ease of building also means that it's not entirely sturdy; because there is no adhesive used, the poles frequently jiggle out of place and my shoes slide down the poles and onto the floor. For the price, it's not a bad shelf, especially for someone on a tight budget who needs extra floor space (a college kid, for instance), but I wouldn't recommend this as a permanent fixture in your home. It's a little ugly and doesn't always work well.
customer_reviews.author: Actual Wizard

customer_reviews.title: broke after 11 months of use. Was nice for a while.. but....
customer_reviews.text: It lasted for 11 months and I had to find a new shoe rack. The weight of the shoes were too much I guess. And now the 3 piece racks wont snap together anymore so only the top portion of the 3 piece is functional. Enough for about 6 pairs of shoes. Another problem were the bars constantly falling off and shoes falling on the ground. It was nice for the 1st month or so. But once the racks started falling off, kind of a hassel for the next 10 months until it broke. It would be best to hang on a door you do not use. As it swings and smashed into the door everytime I closed the door.
customer_reviews.author: bmase

customer_reviews.title: Love this. Organized shoes so much nicer and without ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Organized shoes so much nicer and without netting to collect dust. Love the folding feature as well, adds another element. Also use shelves to hold some lonens, thanks to folding bars as well. Only issue is that the Velcro to hold it to the door was not the best. Probably needs to be a little bigger. Mine came off the door, or the device, and the one that popped off the door peeled the paint up. It’s not something that would stop me from buying another one, but it did make me drop a star and at least want to make note of it to others. Well worth the buy still, but I recommend using another fastener.
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: It works for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pros- this thing holds a lot of shoes and gets them out of my way exactly like I wanted. Easy to set up and took no time at all. Cons- the bars seem to be a little bit short because they’re constantly popping out of the side things and falling. A strong breeze might knock em loose. I may end up just gluing them in place. I also had to remove some bars entirely for my taller shoes, because this thing definitely wasn’t made with boots in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Dooley

customer_reviews.title: It’s work!! 🥰
customer_reviews.text: Fácil de poner en la puerta, lo tedioso es hacer el ensamble! Ten paciencia y con cuidado se puede romper. Hay detalles que no funcionan al 100 pero se pueden buscar alternativas. Lo recomiendo para quien tiene poco espacio y muchos zapatos. Las botas caben perfectamente. Easy to put on the door, the tedious thing is to make the assembly! Be patient and carefully it can break. For those who don’t speak Spanish 😁Thank you There are details that do not work at 100 but you can find alternatives. I recommend it for those who have little space and many shoes. The boots fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Gia

customer_reviews.title: Have some Gorilla Tape on hand!
customer_reviews.text: The unit attaches to the door with little Velcro circles. The problem is that the weight of the shoes when the unit is fully stocked is far too heavy to have the rack remain attached to the door. I have had to Gorilla Tape the rack to the door. Also, flat shoes are likely to slip through the slats; shoes with 2" or higher heels tend to stay put. Now that I've got the rack secured, I like it pretty well but that said, you have to open and close the door gently so as not to knock the shoes off the rack.
customer_reviews.author: nancy the navigator

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE, TERRIBLE PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a nightmare. Do yourself a favor and do not purchase unless you want to constantly have your shoes falling down because this is so poorly made and can not stick together for even moments after assembly, with no weight on it, let alone with shoes... I repeatedly come home to pieces of this having fallen out, shoes having fallen off... it’s a complete disaster & a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Dayna Russo

customer_reviews.title: great idea, but....
customer_reviews.text: This shoe rack is a great idea. However, in my opinion, it's not sturdy. And please read the reviews about not being able to close the door you install it on. THat aside, I assembled it and pounded the poles into place with a great deal of force. But still, it falls apart and shoes go crashing to the floor along with the poles. And mind you, these are not adult shoes. These are shoes for a 10 year old girl. So I will do my best to see what I can do to fix the problem, but so far it's been a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: quechris

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and accommodates a large amount of shoes comfortably
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I needed. It was easy to assemble and fits over the door without making issues with closing the door. I wear a 6 1/2-7 and I can fit 3 pairs of booties on one row. You can adjust the height of each row to accommodate boots and high top shoes. And don’t worry about it flopping away from the door when opening or closing the door, it comes with small Velcro tabs to hold it sturdy against the door for less damage. We are buying a second one and possibly a third.
customer_reviews.author: Rina Highers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to me (so far)
customer_reviews.text: It looks great. I believe instructions had to say clearly what is the minimum door width to allow it to be mounted without interfering with the door as you open or close it. Although it may seem obvious the fact that you may have to cut it short might not be as evident to others. So, instructions must make it more clear. I shortened the rods by 1.5" and it fit perfectly on the small closet I have by my entry door.
customer_reviews.author: Maury

customer_reviews.title: Easy, gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease of this hanger. I felt like it was very easy to assemble and has held together great. It is pictured showing three pairs of shoes on each row and I can only get 2 pairs, plus one shoe on each, but maybe that's just my large shoes - lol. I would definitely purchase again. My sister also had this same rack and loves it. Great product for the price, too!
customer_reviews.author: bw_079

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to assemble, it holds plenty of shoes, but unless you anchor the bottom of this thing to your door, and there isn't really a good way to do that, the shoes will start sliding out of the back as they slide and slowly push the rack away from the door. So, this will work, but you should anchor the bottom before adding shoes. One other thing, the rods are hollow metal and the ends are plastic. Not super sturdy, but it will probably hold up if you don't overload it.
customer_reviews.author: Robbey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Not for 36 pair though.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs. It is easy to put together and install. Fits perfectly on the inside of closet door. It is all the storage that I required but I will say it would not have fit 36 of my casual shoes. I have a size 9 narrow foot so my shoes are not overly wide. I would say it would fit five shoes per row unless they are narrow flip-flops. Could possibly fit 36 with pumps. I would not see it working for as many shoes for men’s shoes. I am extremely satisfied with my order as I did not need more space.
customer_reviews.author: Leanne

customer_reviews.title: Great organization piece.
customer_reviews.text: Had to wait almost 2months to use this product. Reached out to their customer service and had to order a wider hook for the door I planed to put it. My door is a bit thicker than normal doors so they told me they have the piece they can send to me for free but that it was on backorder or something like that. When I assembled all of the pieces, it worked well and keeps all my shoes easily assessable as opposed to having them tossed at the bottom of my closet. It’s been a couple months and it still is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: design flaw unless you have really wide door
customer_reviews.text: Most over-door shoe hangers are vertical pocket type. This product design allows for more pairs of shoes than pocket style, but being more horizontal the shoes protrude significantly further thereby reducing how far you can open door and if on other side, how much space to move through. Bottom line: this would be a great on-wall rack or ok for very wide doors
customer_reviews.author: David H

customer_reviews.title: The quality is mediocre,but can save some place, make sure u got right size、
customer_reviews.text: This shoe rack is easy to install, but the quality is ordinary, the size is easy to make mistakes, the pole will fall apart with a little effort, the upper three floors of this door in my house cannot be used,once I open the door can’t close.... So when you buy it, the door must be 10 centimeters wider than the shoe rack, and the position of the door lock must be calculated..make sure it can fit your door. Especially when the door is closed.,
customer_reviews.author: Tina Zhang

customer_reviews.title: It's cool
customer_reviews.text: It's cool. It's doing it's thing for now. Mine is kind of crooked and doesn't rest flat flat against the back of the door it's hanging on. I have wide ass doors so the hanging brackets did not fit. I had stretch the bracket out then literally play blacksmith and hammer the bracket to fit my door. No mistake of the manufacturer just the size of the door. Might want to consider this(hint,hint). Also small shoes fall off bc there is no backing to keep them from falling through the back. Bigger shoes are fine though. For this I give it 4. BUT I would buy again for my bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Alycia

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together. Hard to keep together
customer_reviews.text: If the bars were a little bit longer I would give this product 5 stars. Alas they aren’t so I won’t. The rack assembles pretty easily the problem is the bars are just barely long enough to connect and once you put shoes on the rack the bars are prone to falling out. Also if you bump the rack in the least the bars will fall and if it is a bar near the top there is a domino effect so several bars fall. My rack is on a stationary door. I cannot imagine using this successfully on a door that is opened and closed.
customer_reviews.author: C. melvin

customer_reviews.title: THE WORST PRODUCT ON AMAZON
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUT THIS SHOE RACK UNLESS YOU WANT TO BE PICKING ALL YOUR SHOES UP OFF THE FLOOL EVERY FEW DAYS!!!! Seriously, the rack pulls away from the door and you will hear the sick sound of all your shoes falling to the floor, repeatedly. I HAVE EVEN GAFFER (DUCK) TAPED both sides on every individual shelf and IT STILL PULLS AWAY FROM THE DOOR. This product is completely useless. Maybe screwing into the door will help but I'm not willing to put screw holes in my door only to find out that they pull out too. I have put this product in the trash and actually feel relieved.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Concept, pathetic Execution
customer_reviews.text: It's been 3-4 weeks since we installed this rack. It was not very easy to assemble, but that is ok, maybe my technique was not optimized. However, after installation, the aluminum rods kept coming out of the groove. The shoes kept falling, if the size of the show is 4-6 then it will definitely fall each time you open the door it is installed on. It can hold 20 pairs post which the aluminum wouldn't remain stable. I thought it was a great concept but only in photographs. Not satisfied with my purchase at all.
customer_reviews.author: Rohit Marwah

customer_reviews.title: Study and well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. I am very much impressed with this. It is much better than the old one I had. And for the same price. I did use a soft rubber mallet to put the pieces together even though it says no tools are needed; I just was not strong enough to get bars in between the rails. I also found I can lay my knee-high boots long ways on the bottom rung and they do not through. This rack appears it will last a very long time. If I should need to replace this I will buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: CINDY C.

customer_reviews.title: Does what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I just received this yesterday. It was easy to put together. Does seem a bit flimsy so hopefully it last awhile but at this price point I expected it not to be super well made. It does hold a good amount of shoes. I wish it was a bit wider since it will only hold 3 1/2 pairs. 1 pair has to be separated or stacked to fit. Also, it didnt fit on the door I wanted it on since that door is an exterior garage door it's a bit wider than the average interior door. Overall I like it.
customer_reviews.author: yvette parkosewich

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: So this is the second one of these I've purchased. The first one burned up, along with the rest of our stuff, in a fire. Once I had enough shoes I went back and bought the exact same one again, because it's that good. I love this thing. Keeps my shoes organized and off the floor. I'd say it is better for womens shoes than mens (when I try to put my husbands shoes on the rack I can only fit 2 pairs per row, not very efficient).
customer_reviews.author: A. C. Shrouf

customer_reviews.title: Life Changer!! (Update ..some issues)
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old helped me assemble it - which was quick. Instructions say 15 minutes think we handled it in 10 minutes This shoe rack has been a life changer! Love it! Holds a lot of shoes - I have not counted but I am happy with it. The door clearance is less obviously once the rack is on - but well worth it. UPDATE: I’m annoyed that the rungs that hold up the shoes constantly fall out and collapse. I’m considering gorilla glue or a glue gun ...but the poles are not staying in place so I’m downgrading my initial rating!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Storage for shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Great organizing device for my shoes. Love having them viewable and off of my closet floor. I need to be a little careful to ensure the poles are solidly in the side pieces, as the door opens and closes frequently. My husband liked mine so much, we immediately ordered one for him. When I first saw the instructions to assemble, I was initially concerned. I laughed at the ‘under 15minutes to assemble’ but it turned out to be true. Such a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rani

customer_reviews.title: Great... in theory only
customer_reviews.text: This rack needs to have something to connect the bottom to the door as well, otherwise the toes of the shoes just push against the door creating a big gap between the rack and the door and the shoes fall through the gap. Also shoes just slide right off— it only works well with high heels. And if you try to return it’s impossible to disassemble. I am not even mentioning that the thickness of the brackets that go over the door made it impossible to shut our door.
customer_reviews.author: Calan T. Dewald

customer_reviews.title: Great item, but was missing instructions
customer_reviews.text: This thing really helped me get my floor in the closet back. I can almost get 3 pairs of shoes on one level but it's just a inch too short. It came like it had been a returned item. Box was already opened and had been taped down on once end. We didn't get instructions either so we guessed on how to assemble. It wasn't difficult but it doesn't lay against my door either, that might be installer error but who knows, without instructions. I do love it and would totally order it again.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Great for over the door
customer_reviews.text: The hooks did not fit over my door because my door is too wide. I contacted Whitmor customer service and they sent me larger hooks for over the door free of charge. I also hot glued all the pieces together to help reinforce them and ensure that it does not come apart. I also added a command strip to the parts that go against the door just to again reinforce it from falling down. Great customer service from whitmor and speedy delivery of the hooks
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend not sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Almost a year old and has fallen apart in the middle twice now. After the first time I remove more than half the shoes as I assumed the weight was too much. Still fell apart again and every time it scares the crap out of me. Will now be purchasing something else after a year.
customer_reviews.author: Aliya

customer_reviews.title: Great storage option with adjustable rack heights.
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased and installed. Don't have a lot of use yet but wanted to comment that I like it so far. If things change, I'll update this. Use it in the garage. Similar to other suggestions - I wall mounted it. Was able to stick it in a small place behind door to house. This eliminated the swinging of the rack every time the door opened but at same time put it "essentially behind the door" in a space that wouldn't be used otherwise. I freed up a lot of space by eliminating shelving for shoes. I really like the ability to flip a rack up so you have more height for boots.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Z.

customer_reviews.title: Space saver! Nailed to wall
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love This!! I don't have a closet. I was going crazy thinking what I was going to do with all my shoes! I didn't want them taking up space but I didn't want to have to get rid of shoes. I found this on amazon and it totally saved my shoes. Originally I put this on my wall but it would prevent my door from closing all the way. That drove me crazy but the product was still great! After reading other amazing comments, I tired a few things. I ended up bending the over door hanger to make it flat and then I drilled a hole and nailed it to my wall. Now it's prefect !
customer_reviews.author: Denisa

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and eventually collapsed - did not last for me
customer_reviews.text: plastic parts are cheap; instructions for assembly are poorly illustrated and written; design around the joints is horrible -- they kept falling apart and eventually the parts collapsed, probably by the sheer weight of the shoes combined with a poor design. I got tired to putting them together yet again so I just threw them away. Sorry that I bought this product.
customer_reviews.author: JeanTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Nice Shoe Rack
customer_reviews.text: This shoe rack is so convenient and easy to use. My only complaints are that you can't really close the closet door, which is minor for me as I wasn't closing it anyway, and I have a hard time getting 6 shoes on each shelf. I can only get 5 of my sneakers on a shelf. I did find with other shoes it helps to turn the shoes on each end with the toes out. Also, when putting it together, I found it was helpful to use a rubber mallet. Even though this rack doesn't measure up 100%, I do find it very useful and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: mesmith322

customer_reviews.title: My shoes keep falling :(
customer_reviews.text: The middle portion doesn't remain in contact with the door at all. I tried using other wall adhesives besides the one's attached and they still don't work. The shoe end up slipping in the gap between the door and the frame. The frame is actually starting to warp o.o I have mostly converse on it so it shouldn't be too heavy? I can't put 3 pairs on one row at all. I am size 7 women's. I am trying to put converse, but they're too wide. I tried alternating rotations and they still don't fit. I think shoes with heels work the best because then they don't keep slipping and falling in the gap
customer_reviews.author: Emma Gerd

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold up, not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.text: If you only intend to hold flip-flops on this thing, then have at it. It has the space I was looking for, but even without using it filled to capacity, it started to sag and the brackets stretched horribly within just a few weeks. Now I'm trying to figure out how to make it work without having to replace it. Not worth the frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Great but smushes what you have in the closet thats hanging
customer_reviews.text: I want to say how much I LOVE THIS PRODUCT! Its so great. Only thing is that if you are using it in a smaller or average sized closet, it will smush into the clothes that are hanging in the closet because physics just works like that. If you have a lot of space between your closet door and the clothes (like maybe a walk in closet) then it is perfect. I just love all the available storage since it can hold so many shoes and they are no longer on the floor
customer_reviews.author: Rino Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, was exactly as advertised and had good instructions. I have size 14 shoes and had no problem placing them on the rack. Some of the larger work shoes needed to be placed in toe first and there was only room for 2 pair on each shelf however my wife had room for 3 pair on each level. After i set the second side i decided to turn it over and check to make certain all bars were seated properly and found a few that were not which was quickly fixed. Make certain you are on a hard surface and check both sides after install and you will be very happy!
customer_reviews.author: D Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Seems sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised that this is mostly compromised of plastic, but it seems sturdy enough so far. Doesn’t let us close the closet door yet, but no shoes have fallen off when you open and close the door which is a plus. Unfortunately this came missing a pole and side plastic piece so we can’t store as many shoes as you’re supposed to. Still deciding if we want to keep or not.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea B. Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Useless and waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your time or money. First I had to cut all the tubes to fit my closet so the door would close. The brackets to hold the shoe rack over the door are flimsy and scratched my door. They send you a couple of Velcro buttons to stabilize the rack When you open the door. These buttons are a joke. After I finally set it up and put my shoes on it, the Velcro buttons to hold it to the door would not stay fastened, so every time the door opens every single shoe came tumbling down.. after this happened with all tricks I could find, nothing worked, I took the thing apart and tossed in the recycling bin.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have plenty of space behind your door opening.
customer_reviews.text: Something I wish I had thought through more, is how much space you need behind the door. In my apartment, there is not enough space behind the door to allow the door to open fully.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Nelson

customer_reviews.title: too wide for my door. made in china assembly.
customer_reviews.text: I can't dock it points because I didn't measure my door. My bad. However, a lot of closet doors are not as wide as other doors in a house. I would have had to remove my doorknob for this to sit properly. That said, the assembly was a pain. The rods aren't all the same size, and they aren't tapered to fit into the holes. Some of them had to be mashed and hammered in, whereas others slipped right in with a little twist. It's ok. I gave mine away.
customer_reviews.author: lachrymal

customer_reviews.title: doesn't fit on garage doors
customer_reviews.text: the hook that goes on the door does not fit. because the hooks are for standard closet doors. not regular doors. I have to find a different way to hang them up. the bars do not sit stable in the holes (but someone who hasn't actually assembled one would not understand..). its cheap. if i didn't have to go through the process of shipping it back, i would've already returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Hagansan

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The Velcro sticky rounds provided with the rack are pretty useless so the rack will sway back and forth unless you get additional mounting tape. One of the flippers broke off and I emailed the manufacturer and they promptly sent me a couple replacements. I was pleased with the customer service. Some flimsy shoes like flip flops will fall off the rungs and boots might flop over and look awkward if you don’t have a boot insert but overall this is a great space saver!
customer_reviews.author: Ketty

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Does exactly what I need!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend put this together and hung it up on the back of our closet door. It works great and cleared the floor from all our clutter shoe piles. It is really sturdy and doesn’t bounce hitting the door when opening and closing.
customer_reviews.author: Alex J.

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but just doesn't quite work out for me--may be ok for you
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Sticks out from door-- use the velcro disks to stick it to the door. Theres no backing so if it isnt stuck to the door there is nothing to keep shoes from sliding between the door and the rack. What i dont like is that it makes the door stick out too far--i just don't have the space to deal with that. The hooks seem like they might stretch out over time trying to hold all those shoes.
customer_reviews.author: SophieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: Had to superglue the poles or it would just fall. Didn’t really hold my shoes all that well being that it’s for bigger shoes. So when we moved we couldn’t take it apart and just tossed
customer_reviews.author: Ilydia Schachtner

customer_reviews.title: Shoes keep falling off
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this at first. But I’ve noticed that my shoes are falling behind the rack and every day I am having to organize my shoes all over again. It comes with sticky Velcro things to stick to the door so there’s no space in between but those aren’t efficient enough because it keeps coming off. It’s very sturdy and I love It but I am tired of having to pick up most of the shoes every day. It almost defeats the purpose. I am not sure how other people are not having this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole!

customer_reviews.title: Fallen off the door 3 times
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to store my husbands dress shoes. The top clips that hang it on the door are very flimsy and if the alignment is off in the slightest, it will fall off of the door when you shut it. So far we can only put half the capacity of shoes in it. This has fallen off of the door 3 times in two months.
customer_reviews.author: stu

customer_reviews.title: Insert silly "Great Rack" joke here!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today and put it together in a very short time. I did need to use a small hammer to gently tap the rods into place, but that just made assembly easier. My big ol feet need big ol shoes, so I have to slant them slightly on the racks to make sure they stay put but on the whole I'd say this is a great shoe rack. Time will tell on the sturdiness of it, but it looks pretty solid put together. Hopefully I won't have to come back and change the rating ever. :)
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Great buy , Worth the bucks.
customer_reviews.text: Material is plastic for the frame and metal (probably aluminum) for the racks. Material is strong enough. It works as it should and it’s very easy to assemble. Only downside is that it cannot fit 36 pairs of shoes unless of course your shoes are smaller like a women’s size 4,5,or 6.5. Otherwise you should be content with fitting 26 to 30 pairs which isn’t bad.
customer_reviews.author: Felix Asare

customer_reviews.title: A great product with a cool feature.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this Over-the-Door Shoe Rack by Whitmor. It holds up to 36 pairs of shoes and has really helped me organize my closet space. It is a little awkward to put together and did take some time doing by myself but once everything was in place it turned out fine. My favorite feature is that each bar has the ability to raise so that I can store larger shoes like Winter Boots. I liked this product so much that I ordered a second one for a different room.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Stratton

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately not very sturdy-
customer_reviews.text: I really want to love this shoe rack. It fits great on our door and cleans up the closet floor. However no matter how tight I push the poles in, they just keep popping out. I find myself having to fix it almost daily, especially on the bottom. My kids don’t even bother using it anymore because it’s annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: I will buy it again once we have a bigger house
customer_reviews.text: Holds 24 pairs of shoes. Downside though, toddler size 8 shoes fall off/ between rails. We didn't put the adhesive down since it's a rental house. It does bounce a little when opening the closet door without the adhesive, but nothing bothersome. Being intentionally slow keeps all our shoes in place. The boys played run house in the closet and slam the door before the other got there and broke a shelf. But with normal use it would hold up well, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent over the door shoe storage solution.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble (needs a small tap with hammer to set poles), sturdy, and holds a lot of shoes. This is great if you don’t have a large closet, and have lots of shoes. I’ve used the cloth and plastic ones before, they tear, they don’t fit larger shoes (men’s), and some are not stable on the door (they come out of the hooks and fall). This one works!
customer_reviews.author: Miatababe

customer_reviews.title: Lots of storage but bulky and wobbly...and broke!
customer_reviews.text: Although this show rack can hold a lot and is simple to put together, I will say it’s is pretty bulky for the back of a door and even with the Velcro stickers provided, it is wobbly on the door. Also when I went to hang it on the door the first time, one of the over the door hooks broke. Not impressed overall😕
customer_reviews.author: Abagail

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a shoe SHELF for several years now- they stopped making my favorite one from Target but I have literally found the exact replacement!!!!! I hate the shoe rack that hangs in your closet like little fabric cubbies. I want to see my beautiful shoes on display and this keeps them organized and protected. This is amazing, super easy to assemble, and made all the difference since I have zero closet space! great find.
customer_reviews.author: MDS

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and not worth your money.
customer_reviews.text: Is not study what so every every shoe I put on ends up making the bars fall off collapsing all my other shoes, can not fit 36 shoes like it claims it can and idk how I have small feet I'm only a size 5 but I can only fit 2 shoes on each rack, and it's just so cheaply made when it's kinda expensive compared to other shoe racks that are better and cheaper so very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product I have a ton of shoes and animals and nowhere safe to store my shoes from said animals. This over the door shoe storage has been a blessing! Do you have a door? and do you have shoes? This might be for you!😬 Just know that your shoes will still get dusty... or at least mine do! 🤣
customer_reviews.author: Shantell Marie Bodnar-Quarders

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: I received this product in February 2020, I easily assembled and hung it over my door and placed my shoes. It is now June 2020 and it is coming apart. Craftmenship of using plastic doesn’t hold up. It’s not overloaded, in fact it’s not full and the clips just don’t keep it together. My window for return or replacement is closed , so I can’t do anything about it, but who knew I was going to have this experience;/ so I would think twice about this purchase:/
customer_reviews.author: Lisa S. Savannah GA

customer_reviews.title: Ladies will love it
customer_reviews.text: I needed a solution to avoid Puppy eating shoes on floor. Apprehensive to try this considering durability, will it be effective and fit properly? YES to all the above, easy to assemble, no issues at all opening and closing door multiple times a day. Very satisfied with purchase and no more puppy 🐶 concerns!
customer_reviews.author: Critter

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to build!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this rack in today pregnant and put myself together!!! Super easy and unbelievably sturdy!!! I’m extremely happy and satisfied with my rack I would buy another!!! And am recommending to my fam n friends!!! My closet door is 28” wide didn’t measure height! But posted a picture! The brackets are also perfect don’t stop my door from shutting at all! Love that when I shut my door the rack stays put no swinging!
customer_reviews.author: Joaquin

customer_reviews.title: Must be for a walk in closet
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good shoe rack, holds a lot of shoes and very reasonable BUT it doesn’t fit on all doors... it has to be on a door that goes into a closet... a walk in closet... it makes it difficult to close your door if it’s not just right in every way and if you bump it, the shoes fall off a bit easy!
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Clam

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Although this item is a little bulky, this is the best shoe holder around. You need some clearance when you are accessing the rack when placed over a Door to be used inside a closet. I thought about mounting it to a wall and using it. Each Rack Folds Upward for Extra Room.
customer_reviews.author: Tina L Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. This product arrived in a shabby box missing a rod and had part of one of the frames embedded in another frame. This product advertises that it holds 36 pairs of shoes. This is false advertising. I was able to fit 22 because of the missing rod and would've only been able to put 24 up with the rod. I have more shoes and there isn't enough space for them! I had to flip my hi tops upside down to fit them in. This is possibly the worst thing I've bought on amazon. Horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and fits all types of shoes and sizes
customer_reviews.text: I have a shoe problem and this helped me get my shoes off the floor and made my fiancé happy! Held all my shoes and my heavy boots with out any problems. Very easy to put together and doesn’t “smush” the shoes at all. The flip up possibility of the arm makes all shoe types and sizes for great! Would recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: It was okay until it wasn't
customer_reviews.text: It was an okay product, somewhat frustrating to put together as pieces would not stay connected, but once I got it up, it was doing it's job. It was on the back of a door I don't close very often, so didn't notice right away that the rack prevented me from closing the door; again not a total deal beaker.. After about 5 months, the thing came tumbling down and left my shoes in a pile. The plastic is bent now and it is not salvageable. So, I would say keep looking unless you only need something to last a brief period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and effective shoe rack
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews before I purchase a product. I saw a number of negative reviews about this shoe rack about it not being sturdy, but it was a tip from a previous reviewer that prompted me to give this rack a try. When you assemble this rack, use a rubber mallet to press poles into supports until completely inserted and snug. You can use a regular hammer as well with a towel or block of wood to protect plastic rack supports. We have tried other floor based shoe racks that did not work well but this rack is very sturdy when assembled correctly and holds a lot of shoes or boots.
customer_reviews.author: johnnrosanna

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: This item says 36 shoes, but that is probably more accurate for children or people with very small feet. Good thing I don’t own that many shoes! Each bar holds two pairs and you may be able to squeeze a fifth shoe on there if you tried. The shifting on each bar is very convenient for when you want to hold boots or high tops. I would note that if you are trying to place this on a wall or anything that’s not a door, it may not work since the mount is over the door. Overall good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very limited use case
customer_reviews.text: I finally got around to tying to striaghten up my shoes and put it together. It is relatively easy to put together and looks like it will hold up for a whille. But the problem is that even with no shoes on it, it is nearly impossible to open the door as it sticks out in such a way as it prevents the door from opening. The only situation where it may work is in a large walk-in closet with a open space behind the door. If there is a wall anywhere near where the door opens this will not work for you. I am very disappointed as the item has become a complete waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: usnrma

customer_reviews.title: Buy this shoe rack! Solves the clutter issue and frees up space!
customer_reviews.text: If you love shoes, but lack space this is the shoe rack for you! Easy to assemble. I was able to get in 30 pairs of shoes, and boots. If I only put in shoes I would have been able to hold 36 pairs. This show rack is awesome! I just ordered another one for my other closet door because I like this product that much. I rarely write reviews, but I had to review this rack. I have over 150 pairs of shoes and boots. The real estate is high in my closet and this show rack solves my closet real estate problems. No, I wasn’t paid for this review!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa S VandenBussche

customer_reviews.title: You may be sorry.
customer_reviews.text: The "over the door" hardware already cannot handle the weight of the shoes, and the rack is only half full!! I think the hardware is far too flimsy to hold up. I expect it to not last more than 6 months. A real drag too since the shoe rack is very well designed otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Duncaha

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Fixing all my shoes including 3 pairs of boots. After used I find out that is not a good shoes organizer because is too heavy and constantly the organizer peels off from the door and the organizer causing shoes to slip between the organizer and the door. I don't recommend after using it for a while. I ended up throwing it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: María G. Soto

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe rack!
customer_reviews.text: This shoe rack is awesome and perfectly fits on the back of my door. It was pretty simple to put together and only took a couple of minutes. I only gave it 4 stars because one of the bars did fall out once it was put together and had shoes on it...however, I probably did not put it together tight enough at the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits MY needs!
customer_reviews.text: It is good for my needs. I installed it on the front of my sliding closet door and it fits fine. I will say that the directions say assembly and installation takes 15 minutes. A bit optimistic! Also, it's helpful to have a hammer handy to "encourage" the rods to got in and stay where they are supposed to. Without the hammer they kept falling out for me.
customer_reviews.author: mm3545

customer_reviews.title: does the job =)
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done but sometimes the pieces come apart and I have to reattach them (insert bar into the side frame). Its a simple basic look. If you put it on a door that you use all the time, you should expect that it will obviously open less wide than before, or at least you should expect that in this case because it does stick out a little bit from the door (not excessively I don't think). I've had this product for almost three years now and I'm probably going to keep it for a long time honestly.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Constant assembly required
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was/is a pain. The support poles constantly fall out. It is not sturdy at all!!! It does not stay on the door well and bows out, causing the shoes to fall between the door and the rack. The adhesive does nothing to hold it to the door. I’ve now strapped the bottom to the door for it to stay.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this shoe rack! Fits perfect on the back of my door. The Velcro stickers it comes wi tv aren’t SUPER strong but it’s also better than putting screws into my door, honestly, it would stay sturdy without them! It holds 36 pairs and I couldn’t be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Petrassi

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: This was for the back of a closet door bit sticks out quite far so that the door opens quite a bit less. I will use it because I bought it but it is far from ideal.I would suggest only light weight shoe or Sandles be put on it as heavier foot ware made the hangers on the door pull away and the whole thing fell.
customer_reviews.author: Joann Logsdon

customer_reviews.title: Good capacity, easy assembly, not too sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is very versatile and easy to put together. But the door brackets are very flimsy and bend out of shape easily particularly when loaded with shoes. If all your shoes are tiny, light sandals you can get 24 pairs on here. But with basic size 8s and a few boots, you will have a great deal of trouble closing the door due to the warping of the brackets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: You definitely need two people to assemble it which is not a big deal. However, one of the metal bars will not stay in no matter what I do. Also, I'm picking the shoes up from the floor about five times a day because they keep falling between the rack and the door. Finally, I had to buy a rope and tie it around the bottom of the rack and the door which isn't ascetically pleasing but the shoes stay on the rack a bit better. I may need to tie another rope around the middle of the rack as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen C.

customer_reviews.title: great shoe rack, but needed help.
customer_reviews.text: I would give it a five star if it stuck to the door without extra screws that I had to supply. the little stickers they send to help hold it against the door are a joke. Once you put the shoes on the SHOE RACK they ALL fall off because the stickers do not hold. I put my own small screws in the bottom and middle of this shoe rack and I LOVE it now. It only holds about 22 adult shoes at a time, unless you want to put 2 and 1/2 shoes on each rack.
customer_reviews.author: Restfornow

customer_reviews.title: Works really well to store tissue paper.
customer_reviews.text: I use a ton of tissue paper for my business. For wrapping up orders & for wrapping up bath bombs. Having stacks & stacks of tissue paper all over the office is a pain & quite honestly not an efficient use of my office space. I bought other type of rack using wooden dolls & such to store my papers, but the rack was for display only & easily broke. After a quick trip to Pinterest, I decided to try using a relatively inexpensive shoe rack instead & I am really happy with the results. So, happy that I decided to purchase another for the rest of my tissue papers. Easy win for an easy space-saving storage hack.
customer_reviews.author: jfire28

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay together
customer_reviews.text: Putting this together was easy enough but some of the bars did not fit! I would try to secure them and the piece would pop out of place with the slightest movement. Made of cheap materials and did not last very long. I didn't have heavy shoes on this rack. I didn't trust it to hold much more than a couple pairs of sneakers. Honestly y'all, spend the extra money and get good materials. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Skiba

customer_reviews.title: A True Space Saver and Organizer
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. It is sturdy enough, easy to assemble (no tools required) and hang over the door. Each shelf can hold two or three pairs of shoes depending on the shoe width. However if someone has high boots they will need to fold one or two shelves to make room for the shoe height. Please note that this unit requires a 12-inch clearance. I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Eneloy

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars for the Shoe Rack plus 5 more for Whitmor's Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I love this rack - easy to put together, solid and adjustable so you can put higher heels or low booties on it! But even more - I got it and discovered that the doors to all my closets were extra thick and the enclosed brackets weren't wide enough. I called Whitmor, the manufacturer, and they immediately offered to send me wider brackets for free! Received 2 this morning. The customer service couldn't be better!!! I have bought Whitmor before for the quality -- now I will buy them for the truly lovely customer service too!
customer_reviews.author: Namaste

customer_reviews.title: Measure width of door, considering doorknob too
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to put together. Hangs nicely on the door. My doorknob is not the ordinary round doorknob. It is a lever type and the shoe rack doesn’t sit flat against the door. We didn’t realize this would be a problem when we bought it. Can’t use all the shelves given the issues with the doorknob. We should have measured the door and compared to location of the doorknob, width of door and width of shoe rack.
customer_reviews.author: David from Philadelphia

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and space-efficient
customer_reviews.text: This hanger is awesome! It is much nicer than the one I replaced. My favorite part is that it does not stick out so far from the back of the door as my old one did. That means it doesn't bounce around like my old one did, which caused the shoes to fall. I love how many shoes I can fit on it. I made sure to measure my door as some other reviewers mentioned. It fits perfectly on my 28" wide door.
customer_reviews.author: JCS

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should
customer_reviews.text: This works well and has held up for well over a year. We have this on the back of our door and fit easily 36 pairs of shoes, mixture of little kid shoes, big kid shoes, womens size 7-8 and some men's shoes. Had to drill in the top holes to the door and left the lower side free, but still works well.
customer_reviews.author: Beth C

customer_reviews.title: went together easy.
customer_reviews.text: It did just what was advertised except the shoes wanted to keep the rack away from the door. I solved the problem by drilling small holes in the plastic and screwing it to the door with small screws. I got another one for the wife's shoes too.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Fits so many pairs
customer_reviews.text: I hang it on the inside of my closet door. There is room for ALL of my shoes on this rack. I reserve the bottom couple of rows for boots, I just have to flip one of bars up so that tall shoes like boots fit. Not great for flip flops or flat sandals as they don't stay on the bars as well as a shoe with a proper heal. But overall-- great product, easy/fun installation. Putting it together was like an easy puzzle. And it makes me feel like my shoes don't take up any room at all.
customer_reviews.author: amanda p.

customer_reviews.title: Helps me keep the shoes in the closet
customer_reviews.text: I was having trouble keeping my shoes put away when I was using an organizer rack that set on the floor. This helps me get them put away, and is a space saver. My closet has an old wooden door, so no issue with its weight or sturdiness.
customer_reviews.author: Karla

product_meta.title: Whitmor Over the Door Shoe Rack - 36 Pair - Fold Up, Nonslip Bars
product_meta.description:
If you need flexibility and control with your shoe storage, look no further. You can efficiently keep your items organized using Whitmor's 36-Pair Over-the-Door Resin Shoe Rack. Made with non-slip coated steel bars, this over the door shoe organizer is coated with durable resin for a glossy and shiny appearance. The non-slip steel bars ensure that your shoes won't fall off when opening the door to start your day. The unique flip-up bar feature allows you to store shoes of all sizes with ease. You can easily hang this Whitmor over-the-door shoe rack with the help of an included hook that fits most doors. This shoe organizer can store up to 36 pairs of shoes, allowing anyone's shoe collection to look neat and organized! Easy to clean, just wipe with a damp cloth and towel dry. Assembled Dimensions: 7.5 x 22.6 x 74.5 inches. Whitmor is a 4th generation family-owned and operated business. Since 1946, Whitmor has been dedicated to bringing organization home by creating products that simplify everyday life. Ensuring that those products are built with integrity, value, and innovation is our commitment to you. And our promise is that we will always be here for you should you ever need us as we stand behind our product 100%. Whitmor customer service is available in English and Spanish Monday through Friday from 8 am - 4:30 pm CST. Call us and we will gladly assist you in your language. You may contact Whitmor toll-free at 1-888-944-8667 or via email at help@whitmor.com.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
36 Pair OTD shoe rack with durable white resin sides and non slip coated steel bars. Non slip door pads prevent scratching and holds rack in place. Unit measures 7.5-Inch by 22.6-Inch by 74.5-Inch.
feature_bullets: Neatly stores and organizes 36 pairs of shoes without taking up additional floor space
All twelve bars have the ability to fold up to create a more customized storage option for shoes of all sizes and heights
Constructed of non-slip coated steel bars with white resin sides
Easy to assemble, no tools required
Coated metal bars keep shoes from sliding or falling off
Non-slip door pads help prevent damage to the door
For over 70 years, Whitmor has been bringing organization home. If you have questions or problems, please contact us for immediate assistance.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars7,966 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Unique Flip Up Bar For Easy Accessibility, Whitmor 6486-1746-Wht Over-The-Door Shoe Rack, White, 36-Pair, Nonslip Door Pads Prevent Scratching And Holds Unit In Place, Easy No Tool Assembly, Holds Up To 36-Pairs Of Shoes, White Resin Sides And Nonslip Coated Steel Bars For Durability
